title: Authors and Citation
text: Nicolas Rode. Author, maintainer. Thomas Lenormand. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rode N, Lenormand T (2024). Lifelihood: Package Estimates Likelihood Individual's Life History. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Lifelihood: This Package Estimates The Likelihood Of An Individual's Life History},   author = {Nicolas Rode and Thomas Lenormand},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: This Package Estimates The Likelihood Of An Individual's Life History
text: Lifelihood class continuous time multi-event models provide joined likelihood events individual life-history (time maturity, reproductive events, death).

what: Data Parsing Functions for Model Output Files — get_seeds
title: Data Parsing Functions for Model Output Files — get_seeds
text: functions parse specific elements model output files, including seeds, likelihood values, parameter ranges, effects, ratio maximum values. functions can handle group--group parsing applicable.

title: Data Parsing Functions for Model Output Files — get_seeds
code: get_seeds(lines, group_by_group = FALSE)  get_likelihood(lines, group_by_group = FALSE)  get_param_ranges(lines)  get_effects(lines, group_by_group = FALSE)  get_ratio_max(lines)  parse(lines, element, group_by_group = FALSE)

title: Data Parsing Functions for Model Output Files — get_seeds
text: lines character vector element represents line output file. group_by_group logical indicating whether parse data group--group manner. Default FALSE.

title: Data Parsing Functions for Model Output Files — get_seeds
text: Depending function: get_seeds: Returns numeric vector seeds matrix seeds group_by_group TRUE. get_likelihood: Returns numeric value likelihood matrix likelihood values group_by_group TRUE. get_param_ranges: Returns data frame parameter names respective min max values. get_effects: Returns data frame effect names, estimates, standard errors. get_ratio_max: Returns numeric value ratio maximum.

title: Run lifelihood program — lifelihood
text: infile file model data fitted customfile file min max boudaries parameter GbyG Option fit full factorail model interactions factors MCMC Perform MCMC sampling parameter convergence estimate 95% confidence interval interval TBD - Check actual meaning SEcal Compute standard error eahc parameter using Hessian matrix saveprobevent TBD - Check actual meaning fitness Reparametrize model one parameter lifetime reproductive success r Reparametrize model one parameter intrinsic rate increase seed1 first seed used random values can found (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiply--carry_pseudorandom_number_generator) seed2 second seed used random values can found seed3 third seed used random values can found seed4 fourth seed used random values can found ntr number thread paralelisation ? nst TBD - Check actual meaning Initial temperature simulated annealing Tf Initial temperature simulated annealing climbrate Rate simulated annealing ? precision TBD - Check actual meaning

title: Run lifelihood program — lifelihood
code: lifelihood(infile="100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt", ntr=10, To=50, Tf=1, seed2=34) #> Error in lifelihood(infile = "100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt",     ntr = 10, To = 50, Tf = 1, seed2 = 34): unused argument (infile = "100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt")

title: Read the output of the Lifelihood program — read_output_from_file
Read the output of the Lifelihood program — read_output_from_file
text: list following elements: datafile Path output file seeds vector four integers representing seeds used simulation likelihood_max maximum likelihood value effects data frame following columns: Name name effect Estimate estimated value effect StdError standard error estimate parameter_ranges data frame following columns: Name name parameter Min minimum value parameter Max maximum value parameter Read output Lifelihood program # path input file_path = file.path(   'data',   'raw_data',   'DataPierrick_GroupbyGroup',   '100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.' )# read output print results fitted = read_output_from_file(file_path) fitted$datafile fitted$seeds fitted$likelihood_max fitted$effects fitted$parameter_ranges

title: Run Lifelihood program — run_lifelihood
text: input_file file model data fitted custom_file file min max boudaries parameter GbyG Option fit full factorail model interactions factors MCMC Perform MCMC sampling parameter convergence estimate 95% confidence interval interval TBD - Check actual meaning SEcal Compute standard error eahc parameter using Hessian matrix saveprobevent TBD - Check actual meaning fitness Reparametrize model one parameter lifetime reproductive success r Reparametrize model one parameter intrinsic rate increase seed1 first seed used random values can found (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiply--carry_pseudorandom_number_generator) seed2 second seed used random values can found seed3 third seed used random values can found seed4 fourth seed used random values can found ntr number thread paralelisation ? nst TBD - Check actual meaning Initial temperature simulated annealing Tf Initial temperature simulated annealing climbrate Rate simulated annealing ? precision TBD - Check actual meaning

title: Run Lifelihood program — run_lifelihood
code: library(here) #> here() starts at /Users/josephbarbier/Desktop/Lifelihood  # path to inputs input_file = file.path(    'data', 'raw_data', 'DataPierrick_GroupbyGroup',    '100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt' ) custom_file = file.path('data', 'custom.txt') # run the program run_lifelihood(    input_file = input_file,    custom_file = custom_file )

title: Run lifelihood program — run_lifelihood_console
code: run_lifelihood_console(   infile = "100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt",   customfile = "custom.txt",   GbyG = 0,   MCMC = 0,   interval = 25,   SEcal = 0,   saveprobevent = 0,   fitness = 0,   r = 0,   seed1 = 12,   seed2 = 13,   seed3 = 14,   seed4 = 15,   ntr = 2,   nst = 2,   To = 50,   Tf = 1,   climbrate = 1,   precision = 0.001 )

title: Run lifelihood program — run_lifelihood_console
text: infile file model data fitted customfile file min max boudaries parameter GbyG Option fit full factorail model interactions factors MCMC Perform MCMC sampling parameter convergence estimate 95% confidence interval interval TBD - Check actual meaning SEcal Compute standard error eahc parameter using Hessian matrix saveprobevent TBD - Check actual meaning fitness Reparametrize model one parameter lifetime reproductive success r Reparametrize model one parameter intrinsic rate increase seed1 first seed used random values can found (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiply--carry_pseudorandom_number_generator) seed2 second seed used random values can found seed3 third seed used random values can found seed4 fourth seed used random values can found ntr number thread paralelisation ? nst TBD - Check actual meaning Initial temperature simulated annealing Tf Initial temperature simulated annealing climbrate Rate simulated annealing ? precision TBD - Check actual meaning

title: Run lifelihood program — run_lifelihood_console
code: run_lifelihood_console(infile="100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt", ntr=10, To=50, Tf=1, seed2=34) #> [1] "\\Users\\josephbarbier\\Desktop\\Lifelihood\\docs\\reference\\100%mort_Pierrick211genoparinteraction.txt \\Users\\josephbarbier\\Desktop\\Lifelihood\\docs\\reference\\custom.txt 0 0 25 0 0 0 0 12 34 14 15 10 2 50 1 1 0.001" #> arguments 'show.output.on.console', 'minimized' and 'invisible' are for Windows only #> Warning: error in running command
